Class BananaPanel1

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • BananaPanel1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BananaPanel1
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    BananaPanel1 handles user directions for the robot's goal coordinates (in the form of dragging and dropping a banana on the screen), and controls animation of the robot in its movement towards those coordinates. Contained by an instance of LayoutContainerPanel.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                    int drawH,
                    int sizeW,

        Constructor sets preferred size to tell layout manager of LayoutContainerPanel how to draw this panel; sets all boolean state variables to false, initializes some graphics elements.

        drawH - used to set drawingHeight
        sizeW - used to set sizingWidth
        sizeH - used to set sizingHeight

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Override of JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics). super.paintComponent() call fills background color. Draws everything. This is what is executed whenever repaint() is called in the program. There are basically four states: (1)Nothing is happening (prompt for dragging a banana pulses); (2)User is dragging a banana around on screen; (3)User is dragging a banana around on screen and is "out of bounds" (red rectangle with warning shows up); (4)User has placed banana and the gibbot is being animated.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context for drawing. Kind of a black box; gets handled in the background somehow

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called when mouse is pressed (not clicked). Uses location of mouse at press event to set boolean state variables. As long as nothing is currently happening (gibbot is not moving), a click on the bunch of bananas image in the top right corner initializes a Banana object and draws it in this class's paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics) method.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called continuously as the mouse is dragged. Only registers if there is a banana object that's being dragged. "Listens" for the user dragging to an "out of bounds" region determined by XBOUND and YBOUND.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • mouseExited

        public void mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called if the user drags out of the panel entirely; current Banana object is set to null.
        Specified by:
        mouseExited in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called when mouse is released after a press event. Only does something if the user has been dragging a banana. If the coordinates of the release event are "in bounds" as specified by XBOUND and YBOUND, gibbot animation is activated.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Specifies how to respond to timer events from GUITimer. This panel uses events as a signal to change promptHighlight color, and to run gibbot animation (which is canned right now; see: Gibbot.arcMotionUpdate(double)). Checks for when gibbot reaches banana and resets panel when it does. Only updates for drawing if awake panel is active.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        evt - The timer event (not important to code but required by java.awt.event#ActionListener interface)
